title: Bob Brady
added: In June 2020, [[Northeast Philadelphia]] ward leader Brian Eddis called on Brady to resign as chair due to "lack of diversity in the party." Brady called a meeting of clergy members and party officials to discuss how to handle [[George Floyd protests in Philadelphia|racial justice protests]] in the wake of the killing of [[George Floyd]] and the violent confrontations that had occurred near the [[Statue of Christopher Columbus (Philadelphia)|statue of Christopher Columbus]] in Marconi Plaza. No consensus was reached.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Terruso|first=Chris Brennan and Julia|title=Philly Democratic Party chair Bob Brady should resign over lack of diversity, ward leader says|url=https://www.inquirer.com/politics/clout/philadelphia-democrats-bob-brady-diversity-john-dougherty-nina-ahmad-20200618.html|url-status=live|access-date=2021-02-19|website=[[The Philadelphia Inquirer]]}}</ref>
